title: Kevin Hart shares grueling video of his physical therapy and says he is thankful to still be here
text:
Comedian Kevin Hart has released a video showing his grueling recovery

Comedian Kevin Hart has released a video showing his grueling recovery after a horror car crash that left him with a severe back injury.

The video released on Tuesday shows Hart's physical therapy following the crash in Calabasas, California on September 1, when a friend was driving his souped-up 1970 Plymouth Barracuda.

'Basically what you realize is that you're not in control. No matter how much you think you're in control, you're not in control,' Hart says in the video.

'When God talks, you gotta listen,' he continues, as clips show him struggling to walk again after being bedridden for weeks.

'Some of the craziest things that happen to you end up being the things that you needed the most. And in this case, I honestly feel like God basically told me to sit down,' Hart goes on.

The video released on Tuesday shows Hart's physical therapy following the crash in Malibu

'Basically what you realize is that you're not in control. No matter how much you think you're in control, you're not in control,' Hart says in the video

Hart had surgery to fuse his spine after fracturing three vertebrae in the crash

'You know you moving to fast and doing too much, sometimes you can't see the things that you're meant to see,' he says.

'But after my accident I see things differently, I see life from a whole new perspective. My appreciation for life is through the roof,' Hart reflects.

The funnyman reflected somberly in the video, thanking his family, friends, fans, and God as he continues his recovery.

At the end of the video, a doctor tells him that it will be a year before he makes a full recovery, to which he replies that he is not in a rush,

Earlier this month, Hart released his first statement since the crash, saying he had 'nothing but love' for driver Jared Black and wished him and his fiancee Rebecca Broxterman a quick recovery.

'Some of the craziest things that happen to you end up being the things that you needed the most. And in this case, I honestly feel like God basically told me to sit down,' Hart says

The video shows Hart's grueling physical therapy regimen as he recovers from the crash

A doctor says it will be a year before he has fully recovered from his injuries

Hart had been traveling with Black and Broxterman when their car veered off the road and plummeted into a ditch in early September, leaving him with major back injuries and needing surgery.

The accident involved Hart's car, but California Highway Patrol said it was Black, the fiance of Hart's wife's personal trainer Broxterman, who was found in the driver's seat when they arrived at the scene.

Despite this, it does not appear Hart has any hard feelings towards his friends.

'I have nothing but love for Jared and wish him and Rebecca a speedy recovery,' he said in a statement released through his attorney on Thursday.

Kevin's attorney Andrew Brettler said that Kevin will not be fully back to work until early next year, according to EW.

'While he's doing a little work here and there for the film, he doesn't expect to be fully back to work until the new year,' the attorney said.

The comedian, 40, had to have his spine fused back together after breaking it in three places following the smash in Malibu, California, earlier this month.

New details have emerged following the accident, with law enforcement sources telling TMZ last month that 'none of the three people in the car were wearing seat belts'.

Kevin, pictured with his car, purchased the 1970 Plymouth Barracuda earlier this year as the ultimate birthday gift to himself to celebrate turning 40

The car is seen after the crash, where rescue units had to remove the roof with the jaws of life

Scenes from Kevin Hart's car accident in Calabasas just yards away from his house

Law enforcement reportedly stripped down Hart's vintage car and found it 'did not have any mechanical issues' and that the crash was caused by 'driver error'.

Hart left the scene of the smash last month while his two friends - his wife's personal trainer Broxterman and her fiance Black who was driving - remained trapped in the vehicle, according to the crash report.

Police did find extensive bodywork including adding sports tires and a 6.4L Hemi V-8 engine. The car was reportedly without an anti-lock braking system.

The report states: 'There were fold and crease marks on the belt surfaces consistent with being folded and tucked into the seats and no indicators of occupant loading were present.'

If they had been worn, police add: 'They were being worn improperly due to excessive slack in the belts.'

Broxterman, 40, is said to have been found facing the windshield between the right passenger seat and the roof. The report states the car was 'not outfitted to carry rear seat passengers'.

Comedian Kevin Hart, left, personal trainer Rebecca Broxterman, right with her fiancé Jared Black were all in the September 1 car crash which left Hart and Black with serious injuries. New details have emerged following the accident, with law enforcement sources telling TMZ on Thursday that 'none of the 3 people in the car were wearing seat belts'

Hart, who had plastic storage boxes to replace the backseats, told TMZ: 'I have nothing but love for Jared and wish him and Rebecca a speedy recovery.'

However the site also said their sources have stated there will be 'multiple lawsuit[s] stemming from the crash'.

Meanwhile, the comedian is reportedly back in action promoting his upcoming action sequel Jumanji: The Next Level, according to TMZ.

The stand-up talent showed up for several hours worth of video shoots on set on Monday, in addition to another two-hour shoot on Tuesday and one more slated for Thursday.

While Hart is still not back to full health after the accident, the comedian is still committed to fulfilling his obligations.

Although returning home from rehab on September 20, the funnyman is still in a lot of pain and working with a physical therapist to help with his recovery.

Doctors have told Hart that with time and exercises to help his recovery he will soon be back to where he was before the crash.

After the accident, the actor's wife Eniko Hart confirmed Kevin was doing well, saying he was 'going to be just fine' in video obtained by DailyMail.com.

His back surgery was declared 'a complete success' by sources for The Blast.

Hart's vintage car veered off the road during the first weekend of September and plummeted into a ditch, leaving the comedian with major back injuries.

The comedian was left hospitalized following the horror crash in the early hours of Sunday morning in the hills of Malibu.

Hart is thought to have been a passenger in a 1970 Plymouth Barracuda with his wife's personal trainer Rebecca Broxterman, 31, and her fiancé Jared Black, 28.

Black, who was allegedly driving, lost control of the car as it veered off the road and went down a hill off Mulholland Highway around 1am.

Black and Broxterman, an Instagram fitness model, were trapped inside when authorities arrived.

'Hart and Black sustained major back injuries as a result of this collision and were transported and treated at nearby hospitals,' Highway Patrol said in a report.

Broxterman sustained no injuries and Black was not under the influence.

Witnesses revealed that a member of Kevin's security team 'showed up in an SUV and picked him up'.

A concerned friend of Hart told 911 dispatchers the comedian was unable to move and incoherent following his horror crash, reports TMZ.

She also claimed the incident had taken place just 20 minutes before she made the call, contrary to police records.

This twist in the bizarre saga came hours after a witness, who also dialed 911 in the immediate aftermath of the crash, said he saw Hart being helped from his totaled 1970 Plymouth Barracuda by security from the driver's side window before being whisked away in a black Escalade.

California Highway Patrol reportedly said it was Jared Black, the fiance of Hart's wife's personal trainer, who was found in the driver's seat when they arrived.

Later, calling from Hart's home at 2.13am, the unknown female caller said the comedian was in an extremely bad way, was 'not coherent at all' and that 'he can't move' while also pointing to a protrusion like injury to his back.

The caller also said, 'he can't move' and had injured something on his back. She said the accident took place 20 minutes ago outside of their gated community - despite the crash occurring nearer to 1am, according to police and witness records.

The comedian, pictured in May, is thought to have been in the passenger seat the time time of the crash earlier this month

Photos from the scene of the collision were horrific and showed the vintage car completely wrecked.

The day before the crash, Kevin took the bright blue vehicle out for a ride and spun out his tires for a quick video shared to Instagram.

He purchased the car earlier this year as the ultimate birthday gift to celebrate his 40th birthday.

The California Highway Patrol now reportedly plans to disassemble Hart's 1970 Plymouth Barracuda to see if new safety laws for restored classic cars are needed.

The process may last up to a month, with one week allotted to disassemble the car, and another two to three weeks to evaluate the evidence and write the report.

CHP will investigate whether the car was improperly restored, and whether any mechanical failure contributed to the crash.
description: The video released on Tuesday shows Hart's physical therapy following the crash in Calabasas, California on September 1, when a friend was driving his souped-up 1970 Plymouth Barracuda.
